boardgame.name: Maharani
boardgame.description: Game description from the publisher:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Maharani, the players are architects helping the King to complete the Taj Mahal palace by placing beautiful mosaic tiles. These tiles come into play through a rotating rondel, which enables every player to place the tiles in different parts of the palace. Once the mosaic is complete, the best architect wins the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Games 328 - K2, Indigo, and Maharani

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: mint!
German version.
original German Queen edition punched_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bagged, unplayed in perfect condition (game and box) the game is language independent and the English rules are available at the geek

Queen Games (QNG60911F) Players are architects, helping the King to complete the palace -Taj Mahal, by placing beautiful mosaic tiles. These tiles come into play through a rotating rondel, which enables every player to place the tiles in different parts of the palace. Once the mosaic is complete, the best architect wins the game.
Reserved for David Williams at $20.00
Reserved for David Larson
